thread.title: Projected Manchester United starting XI vs Everton
thread.title_full: Projected Manchester United starting XI vs Everton

author: paulmbanks
title: Projected Manchester United starting XI vs Everton
text:
Tweet International break is finally over, so we can once again post our Manchester United starting XI. Bastian Schweinsteiger pulled out of Germany’s match against the Republic of Ireland during warm-ups due to a thigh injury. He did however, report to United’s Carrington training ground today, and his status for the Everton match on Saturday is still up in the air. 
Wayne Rooney was sidelined by an ankle injury suffered during a training session with England while Michael Carrick picked up a groin problem. 
However, both are expected to play, as England manager Roy Hodgson said : 
“From Michael’s point of view, and United’s, the rest will do him good. I fully expect to see him and Wayne Rooney fit for United and Louis van Gaal next weekend.” 
That said, here is the Manchester United starting XI prediction Anthony Martial Memphis Depay Wayne Rooney Juan Mata Morgan Schneiderlin Michael Carrick Matteo Darmian Daley Blind Chris Smalling Phil Jones David de Gea Bet365 has Everton odds of winning at 9-4, a draw at 12-5 and a United victory at 11-8. ESPN’s Soccer Power Index gives Everton a 37% chance of winning, while United has a 34% chance. The SPI places the chances for a draw at 30%. As always, please feel free to post your own Manchester United starting XI in the comments section below. Enjoy the match!
